com.bfo.json

Class JsonReadOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bfo.json.JsonReadOptions

  • public class JsonReadOptions
extends Object

    This class controls the details of the Json.read() call. The various flags set on this class can control the read process, and in some cases (e.g. setStrictTypes(boolean)) determines how the objects behave after they are read.

    The class uses a "fluent" style to enable setting multiple options at once, eg. 

      json.read(out, new JsonReadOptions().setAllowUnquotedKey(true).setAllowComments(true));

    All flags default to false.

      JsonReadOptions setAllowComments(boolean comments)
      Whether to allow comments in the JSON input, eg ["a"]/*comment*/.
      JsonReadOptions setAllowTrailingComma(boolean trailingComma)
      Whether to allow trailing commas in the JSON input, eg ["a",].
      JsonReadOptions setAllowUnquotedKey(boolean unquotedKey)
      Whether to allow unquotedKey keys in the JSON input.
      JsonReadOptions setBigDecimal(boolean bigDecimal)
      Set whether real numbers that cannot be guaranteed to be exactly the same when stored as a Double should be stored as a BigDecimal.
      JsonReadOptions setLooseEmptyStrings(boolean looseEmptyStrings)
      When the strictTypes flag is not set, this flag will determine whether empty strings evaluate to zero when treated as a number and false when treated as a boolean.
      JsonReadOptions setNFC(boolean nfc)
      Set whether to normalize all Strings (including map keys) to Unicode normal form C
      JsonReadOptions setStrictTypes(boolean strictTypes)
      Determines whether objects read by the JsonReader will be loosely typed.

      • setAllowUnquotedKey

        public JsonReadOptions setAllowUnquotedKey(boolean unquotedKey)
        Whether to allow unquotedKey keys in the JSON input. This is not officially allowed, but still common. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        unquotedKey - the flag
        Returns:
        this

      • setBigDecimal

        public JsonReadOptions setBigDecimal(boolean bigDecimal)
        Set whether real numbers that cannot be guaranteed to be exactly the same when stored as a Double should be stored as a BigDecimal. The default is false, which means every real number read by the JsonReader will be converted to a Double.
        Parameters:
        bigDecimal - the flag
        Returns:
        this

      • isBigDecimal

        public boolean isBigDecimal()
        Return the value of the "bigDecimal" flag as set by setBigDecimal(boolean)
        Returns:
        the flag

      • setStrictTypes

        public JsonReadOptions setStrictTypes(boolean strictTypes)
        Determines whether objects read by the JsonReader will be loosely typed. With this flag set, calling Json.intValue() on the string "123" will result in a ClassCastException being thrown rather than a silent conversion to integer.
        Parameters:
        strictTypes - the flag
        Returns:
        this

      • isStrictTypes

        public boolean isStrictTypes()
        Return the value of the "strictTypes" flag as set by setStrictTypes(boolean)
        Returns:
        the flag

      • setLooseEmptyStrings

        public JsonReadOptions setLooseEmptyStrings(boolean looseEmptyStrings)
        When the strictTypes flag is not set, this flag will determine whether empty strings evaluate to zero when treated as a number and false when treated as a boolean.
        Parameters:
        looseEmptyStrings - the flag
        Returns:
        this

      • isLooseEmptyStrings

        public boolean isLooseEmptyStrings()
        Return the value of the "looseEmptyString" flag as set by setLooseEmptyStrings(boolean)
        Returns:
        the flag
